document.docAuthor: Huang, Junhao, Yoshitake, Hiraku, Zhang, Runzhi & Ito, Motomi
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic Review of the Genus Rhinoncomimus (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Ceutorhynchinae) with description of a new species from Yunnan, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic Review of the Genus Rhinoncomimus (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Ceutorhynchinae) with description of a new species from Yunnan, China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Rhinoncomimus robustus Voss, 1958 a: 66
(in key; type locality: Fukien, Kuatun).—Korotyaev, 1997 : 288 (as a distinct species); 2006 : 106 .—Colonnelli, 2004 : 33 (in catalog)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 81–88. Male and female terminalia of
Rhinoncomimus robustus
from Fujian, China. (81–85) Male. (81) Penis, dorsal view. (82) Apex of the penis, dorsal view. (83) Penis, lateral view. (84) Tegmen. (85) Sternites VIII and IX. (86–88) Female. (86) Sternite VIII. (87) Coxite and stylus. (88) Spermatheca. Scale bar: 0.20 mm for 81–86, 0.10 mm for 87–88.

Biological notes. Plant association remains unknown.

Remarks. This species is the largest in the genus. It can be distinguished by its strongly convex pronotum with longer subapical constriction and the thick penis. It differs from
R. klapperichi
and
R. continuus
, in its strongly curved rostrum, deeply depressed frons, and less developed mucro on male meso- and metatibia.
